Description: Egyptian terracotta figure of a dog. Head of a Sothic dog, ears erect above the face; face elongated towards muzzle. Mould-made and hollow. Traces of white coating. Micaceous red-brown Nile silt with grey core.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Egyptian Museum, Cairo. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

Sothic dog, commonly published with Roman parallels (Dunand 1990, no. 871), however this example came from a 'Ptolemaic context' according to Leonard and Berlin. Subsequently, the context was found to be contaminated with possible Roman sherds. Representation of the Dog Star, Sirius, associated with Isis. Dunand, F. 1990, Musée du Louvre. Département des antiquités égyptiennes. Catalogue des terres cuites grécoromaines d'Egypte, Paris.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (DD.185) (Phase 3)
Additional IDs: Excavation/small finds number: MC#52b (Finds catalogue number)
